1.content:
"So...this is the place?"

"Yup."

"Looks creepy."

"Yup."

"Very creepy."

Pushing the heavy gates open, the small group of women stepped into a thick layer of fog. It was only Seven O'clock in the evening, but darkness had fallen quickly, and they could barely see two feet in front of them. Using the flashlight on her iPhone, the tallest of the group led the way towards the vast, looming mansion before them.

The building had been abandoned for years, but never demolished. Rumours swirled that it's former owners had been into all sorts of strange, dark arts, and the entire area had been avoided by the locals for the last few decades. It was an imposing sight, towering over the small forest that surrounded the remote area in which it was located.

The group moving gingerly through the fog would rather have been anywhere else; but they were all united by a common goal. The night before, their friend, Stacey, had been on one of her regular jogs through the woods, when she had decided to take some pictures with the mansion in the background. The last time they had heard from Stacey, she had joked about looking inside and taking some pictures for her Instagram, and then...nothing.

"I think I have the door," the leader of the group fumbled for a door knob, shining the light from her phone on the enormous, mahogany entrance to the building.

With an ominous creek, the front door swung inward, allowing the group to step over the threshold and into the house. They were more than a little alarmed to see that the entire main hall was illuminated by fully lit candles and lanterns, creating a warm glow everywhere they looked.

"Well...this isn't terrifying at all," said Emma, adjusting her glasses as she looked around the room nervously.

"It looks like the Bates Motel," said Carrie. She had come straight from work and was still dressed in a button up shirt and tight skirt.

"Let's just hurry up and get out of here," said Beth, rubbing her shoulders to stay warm. "I bet she's not even here."

"Well, we're here now," said the leader of the group, a tall, determined looking girl named Katie. "We know for a fact that Stacey was here. Let's see if we can call her from inside..." Katie reached into her pocket and took out her phone, only to find she had absolutely no signal. "Ah crap...anyone got any signal?"

One by one, the others checked their phones, and shook their heads.

"Well. That's a good start," Emma sighed.

"Okay...plan of action...we split up and search this place. Sound good?"

Characters

Katie:
Aged 24. Confident, practical and a natural leader. Katie is very determined to find her missing friend. She is very athletic and has a fit, toned body. Works as a personal trailer.

Emma:
Aged 23. Very intelligent, with a sardonic, witty sense of humour. A bit of a geek .Has a curvy figure and wears glasses. Works as a lab assistant.

Beth:
Aged 22: A little ditzy, doesn't enjoy being on this search very much at all, but cares a lot about her friends. Takes great pride in her slim, perfect body and good looks. Aspiring actress.

Carrie:
Aged 24: A hard worker and a enthusiastic member of the group, Carrie is a good peace maker and very open and friendly. Carrie is a little chubby after starting a new office job recently.

"'Once a woman begins the process of becoming a blueberry, the transformation and expansion are completely irreversable.'" Katie read. "'It is also completely impossible to remove any of the juice from a blueberry woman. They will continue to swell for the remainder of their lives, but only by a few inches.'"

"Well, that's just peachy." Emma said. "So even if I'm stopped from becoming a full berry, I'm stuck like this for the rest of my life." Then she thought for a moment. "So it says the process can't be reversed, but can it be stopped?"

Katie scanned the book. "Yes!" She yelled, before reading. "'The process of becoming a full blueberry woman can be delayed by consuming juice from another fruit. The two juices will briefly cancel each other out and the bloating stops. However, this only lasts for an hour before expansion resumes.'"

"That's something at least. Maybe they'll be some fruit juice in the kitchen." Emma said. "What about stopping it permanently?"

Katie scanned the entire book. "Doesn't say anything about that." Katie replied. She then notcied something on the cover of the book. "You said the ghost's name was Mary, right?"

"Yeah." Emma replied.

"Well, this book was written by a Mary Crane." Katie replied, showing the cover. Sure enough, the name Mary Crane was there.

"She wrote a book on this?" Emma asked. "Why? What is she planning?"

Katie flipped through the book again, and saw a sticky note. Taking it off, she read it:

"Things are progessing smoothly. If everything works out, then I'll be able to..."

1251213211212221121332212221221111112311.content:
Two Years Later

"Morning, honey." Stacey said as she kissed Katie.

"Moring, sweetie." Katie answered back.

It was Katie and Stacey's one year wedding anniversary, and they had gone to a small cabin out in the forest. It was just them and nature. Well, them, nature, and the automated cabin.

Since permanently becoming berries, the two needed more help with their day to day activities. They could roll themselves just fine, but other things were now impossible. The cabin's automated systems helped with that. Just now, the cabin had made them breakfast.

The two rolled into the cabin's kitchen, and the automated kitchen helped them eat breakfast, since their hands were in no position to do so. Once that was done, they rolled to the fireplace to just relax.

"Mmm... so nice to just get out of town for a while." Stacey said.

"I know." Katie replied. "Still, some days I wish I could see my feet. Or eat on my own."

Stacey looked over her wife. "I think you've swollen again. By about an inch." She said.

"Darn." Katie muttered.

Despire being full berries now, Katey and Stacey were still swelling, though at a very slow rate. In a few years time, they might be too large to fit in the cabin. But that was years away.

"Beth invited us to the premire of her new movie, Blue Romance." Stacey said.

"Will Carrie and Emma be there?" Katie replied.

"Emma's still getting used to sharing a body with Mary, so she's out, but Carrie will be." Stacey answered.

Katie sighed. "It's so rare to see Emma these days." She said. "She's being called a hero for stopping the Blueing from affecting future generations, but no one sees her."

"That makes the moments we do see her all the more special." Stacey replied. Katie just smiled.

The Earth had changed, sure. But in the end, life finds a way to adapt.

She was older now and a well respected scientist thanks to her paper on the biology of her own body and possible ways to adapt to it. Of course, she was still blue and very much big and filled with juice.

After they had decided to forego being cured, a research team charged into the mansion and conducted a massive raid. Though they did not encounter Mary, they did find the girls under the mansion. They quickly got them out and after that, the mansion completely caved in on itself as if it signified the end of such a place. The only thing that remained standing was the greenhouse with the blueberries that changed their lives forever.

It wasn't all bad for the girls. Beth's new body quickly gained popularity with a number of small time directors, giving her the chance to live her acting dreams. She was nicknamed the Bluest Girl in Hollywood.

Carrie quit her job and moved out to the country where she went on entering herself in a few country fairs. I mean, she was technically produce. She's racked up a ton of blue ribbons and earned a lot of money.

Katie and Stacey, they were married a year after the rescue and spend their lives together. They used their fitness smarts and figured out how to move their bodies on their own. Katie is still a personal trainer but she uses her skills to help the other women like her navigate their new bodies, proving they don't need to rely on anyone but themselves and each other.

Emma finished her drink as she gave a little burp. "Well Mary...not sure where you are now but...thanks for the blue." she giggled before waddling off as Mary looked down from above with a smile before fading. She may have failed to paint the world blue...but she touched the lives of these five friends.

Emma let out a surprised yelp as the mysterious maid marched towards her and gripped her arm tightly. Before she could protest, she was pulled down the nearest corridor, which happened to be the one she had just come from.

"Uh, I was just here..." Emma tried to say, but Samantha wasn't having it.
"Perhaps you were. But from the states of these doorknobs, you decided not to enter any of the adjoining rooms. It would be a terrible shame if we decided to ignore them, even more so if your friend is hiding within one of them".

Emma wanted to argue back, but found she couldn't. Samantha was right, both about her ignoring the doors and about Stacey. What if she was lurking in one of these rooms? She wouldn't be conducting a very thorough search if she passed by every single door she came across. And plus, with Samantha at her side, perhaps all the hauntings would cease. Or she hoped so anyway...

"I believe this to be a good starting point".
Samantha paused halfway down the corridor and looked at a door. Finally letting go of Emma's arm, she pushed open the door and gestured for her to enter. Hesitantly, Emma creeped inside...

=====


Watching as the brunette cautiously tiptoed onto the room she had chosen, a smile spread across Samantha's face. Normally, her Mistress would be the one to guide intruders and irritating guests to these rooms, but every so often, that duty fell to Samantha. She just hoped that Emma wasn't crucial to any plans...

"I don't see anybody!" Emma called from within the room.
"Are you positive?" Samantha responded, moving so she was standing in the doorway. "Odd... I was sure I heard somebody in here earlier. Perhaps over there?"

Pointing towards a corner that seemed darker than the rest, Samantha saw hesitation flash across Emma's face.
"I dunno..."
Sighing, Samantha entered the room. It was another dining room, however compared to her Mistress's own personal one, it was much smaller. Connected to it was a kitchen and opposite the door they had come in was a door leading out into the grounds.

"I assure you. While I am here, no harm will befall you".
Emma looked at her for a moment before nodding.
"If you say so..."
Emma slowly creeped towards the corner. As she did, Samantha stepped out of the room, allowing the room to work its magic.

Emma looked towards the wall next to her, which had a blackened and dusty fireplace set into it. However, that wasn't what drew her attention. Rather, she looked at the massive portrait hanging over the fireplace.

Depicted with its full golden frame was a teenage girl, not much older than eighteen. Long golden locks hung down over her face, while her icy blue eyes stared right back at Emma. Her body, average at best, was clad in a bright pink dress with an opening for her breasts, allowing a little cleavage to be seen.

Compared to the rest of the room, which was covered in dust, dirt, mould and other things that had built up over the years, the portrait looked as though it had been hung up about an hour ago. Emma found herself drawing closer to it, her hand reaching out to touch the golden frame...

=====


From the doorway, Samantha watched Emma draw closer to the golden frame, her mouth agape slightly. Had she taken the time to read the small plaque underneath the painting, she would've seen that the girl depicted in the picture was Lady Alice Belview, the younger sister of her own Mistress.

Compared to her Mistress, who was the very picture of gluttony and lust, Alice had been very vain while she had walked the earth. She spent hours in front of a mirror, making sure her appearance was as immaculate as possible. She had watched her weight closely, making sure that not a pound of fat adorned her perfect frame.

While Alice was incredibly vain, she had gotten on well with her sister. Her Mistress had doted on her, granting almost any wish she desired. While her Mistress had not expressed an interest in her return, Samantha had decided to take the initiative and grant Alice a body. She just hoped that she was around to accept it...

Feeling her fingers brush against the cold frame, Emma froze. Her eyes widened as a figure, identical to the girl in the painting, floated out, a grumpy look on her face. She floated down beside Emma, her arms crossed unhappily.

"Get off my frame!" She demanded, glaring at Emma. "You'll get dirt on it!"
Emma didn't respond immediately, still trying to get over the shock of the girl actually appearing.
"Are you deaf or something? No touching!"

The girl reached out, intending to push Emma away. Instead, her hand phased through her, causing even more shock for Emma as chills raced through her body. She stumbled backwards, almost tripping over her own feet as she did so. Pressing her back against the wall behind her, she took a few deep breaths before laughing nervously.

"Okay, guys!" She called out. "Very funny! You got me... You can turn the projector off now!"
Opposite her, the girl frowned.
"Projector? I don't know what that is, but if there are others here... Well, let's just say my sister won't be too happy to see them. But as for you..."

The girl turned to the door with a grin. Emma followed her look until she saw Samantha lurking in the doorway, her face hidden by darkness.
"Remind me to thank her, Samantha! I've been waiting years for a body..."

The girl turned back to Emma with the same grin on her face. Slowly, she floated forwards, an arm reaching out...

Emma stumbled away from the figure's outstretched hand, however she could do little more than that. Feeling the back of her legs collide with what felt like a sofa, she fell backwards into it, her body sinking into its incredibly soft cushions.

"Oh, I do love that sofa!" The girl cooed happily, pausing in front of Emma, who was now completely frozen. "However, we do have a problem with it at the moment".

"H-Huh?" Emma stammered back, her eyes refusing to leave the apparitions face.

As her hands phased harmlessly through her pale torso, Emma's vision began to darken and her thoughts began to leave her...

From the doorway, Samantha watched with amusement as the girl tried to yank Alice out of her mouth. Failing to do so, her arms fell uselessly to either side of her body, twitching slightly as more and more of Alice entered her body.

As the last of Alice's ghostly form slid into the girl's mouth, which still hung open in shock, Samantha finally left the doorway. Striding into the room, she stood opposite Alice's new body, looking down at it with curiosity.

When she looked back, she saw that Alice had...

As the glow gradually died down, Samantha looked back over at Alice. Unfortunately, she still had a slight brightness to her, meaning she couldn't discern whether or not her attempt at casting had succeeded or not.

"Well?" Alice demanded in a voice that sounded a little closer to her own. "How do I look?"

"Oh... Right".
She mumbled another few lines, causing her glowing skin to slowly return to its normal hue, starting at the top of her body. Samantha watched curiously, interested to see if Alice could actually rival her sister or if she was just bluffing.

As Alice's face was revealed, Samantha found that she might not have been bluffing after all. Gone was her old head, replaced with an exact copy of Alice's. Her blonde hair spiralled down around her shoulders and her icy blue eyes darted around the room. The only irregularity was a pair of crooked glasses that had slid down her petite nose and now rested precariously on the tip of it.

Already impressed by how she had remodelled her face, Samantha was even more impressed when she laid eyes on Alice's torso. During her first life, Alice had not been blessed like her sister. She had had a total of one growth spurt, and even then, it wasn't much of a growth. Her breasts had been a pair of bumps on her chest and her lower body could only have been described as 'boyish'.

That description was no longer apt, as Alice had managed to retain the curves of her body's former owner, leaving her with a pair of hefty looking breasts, a set of hips that looked close to surpassing the width of her shoulders and a round backside that wouldn't look out of place on a woman ten years older than her.

The glow eventually disappeared altogether, allowing Samantha to inspect the rest of her body, not that much else had changed. She had lost a good bit of height, bringing her back down to her original less than average height, but that was about it.

"So? You can see me now, right?" Alice demanded, folding her arms. "How do I look?"
"Exceptional, Lady Alice," Samantha answered, looking down at the now eighteen year old girl. "I see your sister has taught you well".

"Well, I am great at magic!" Alice boasted. "Can't believe you doubted me! Anyway, these clothes are way too bland for my tastes. Lead me back to my room and help me change, would you?"
"But Mistress -"
"Is probably still sleeping!" Alice cut in. "It won't take that long! Plus, I'm not asking. You come with me and you help me, or I complain to Aurelia. Got it?"

Samantha nodded and headed for the door. Alice followed, but not before giving her new chest a loving squeeze.
"This new body is great..." She mumbled to herself. "I'm glad that spell actually worked..."

Even before the glow had had a chance to subside, Samantha knew that something had gone wrong. Having been present for many spells cast by her Mistress, she had picked up on certain things that indicated whether or not the spell would be successful. When Alice had started to cast, she had struck the wrong pose and mispronounced a good few words. How that would affect her spell, she didn't know. What she did know was Alice probably wouldn't have the curves she so desired once that glow died down...

Finally, Alice's shine began to die down, revealing her new form to Samantha. As it did, an amused smile slowly began to spread across her face. She had fully expected something to go wrong, but this? She wouldn't have guessed this would be the result of her errors.

"What the hell?! Why do I feel so heavy?!"

Alice had got one part right in that she now looked like herself, with her icy blue eyes and golden curls, but what had went wrong was that she was now a good bit heavier. Nowhere near her sister's size, but she was definitely bigger.

Less than average breasts had swollen into melons of fat that strained her t-shirt. A bulging gut that made her look pregnant had formed, forcing the hem of the shirt upwards. Her boyish hips and flat backside had grown to strain her pants, which clung tightly to her soft lower body. And finally, her delicate face was now framed by a second chin and pair of plump cheeks.

As the glow disappeared, silence reigned in the parlour as both Samantha and Alice stared at Alice's body. While Alice wore an expression of pure fury with a hint of embarrassment, Samantha still had her mirthful smirk, however a little pity for her Mistress' sister had crept into it.

"Should I call the Mistress to come and fix this, Lady Alice?"
Samantha finally broke the growing silence. If it was up to Alice, she'd stand there forever, staring at her plump form with disbelief. Plus, she was still a servant of the house. It was her job to serve both her Mistress and Lady Alice to the best of her abilities. To not offer to help would be shirking her duties.

"No need, Samantha. I witnessed everything".
Alice looked up from her belly with a look of pure rage.
"You!" She growled, pointing a finger at her sister, whose immense form now filled the doorway. "You had some part in this! Change me back! Now!"

Samantha stepped aside with a bow as her Mistress strode into the room. Her dress, which had specially designed to fit her massive body, swayed and bounced as she moved towards her plump sister, a smile on her face.

"It's been so long since we've seen one another, Alice, and you accuse me of this?" Aurelia said, feigning a look of hurt. "Why, I would be hurt if it wasn't true! But I can't have anybody thinking they're a more advanced user of magic than me, can I? It wasn't hard to overwrite your clumsy spell. After all, you made so many mistakes while casting!"

Alice's mouth moved wordlessly as she tried to form a sentence.
"I didn't... You did... I'm better than... Mistakes?!"
Aurelia nodded.
"Yes, mistakes. Mispronounced words, incorrect gestures and unfamiliarity with your new body... I could go on, but I won't. Instead, I am going to make you an offer. Admit that I'm the superior caster, and I will give you your body back. If your apology is sufficient enough, I may even give you the curves you've desired all your life. What say you, dear sister?"

Alice glared at her sister, then at her belly, then back at her sister and finally back at her belly. She let out a huff before responding...

Wow! And the way you're staring at me right now... Your facial expressions are top-notch! Are your creators listening right now? Can I speak to them?"

Emma spoke excitedly, seemingly oblivious to the now furious expression decorating the girl's face. As she began to ask about who originally created her, the girl let out a scream, stomping her ghostly foot.

"Enough!" She yelled, shaking her head. "I don't even understand half the words you're saying! Just... Shut up, stand there and let me possess you already!"

"SHUT UP!"
Roaring at the top of her lungs, the girl lunged at Emma, who just about managed to duck under her outstretched arms. Realizing that, perhaps, she wasn't too friendly, Emma decided to finally run for it. Sprinting towards the door, she let out a shocked about as she collided with Samantha, who blocked the door with her body.

Samantha shook her head solemnly.
"I'm afraid Lady Alice requires a body. And as my spirit already possesses this one, you will have to provide for her. It was a pleasure knowing you, Emma. Now, be a dear and remain still. Lady Alice doesn't like unnecessary exercise".

Looking over her shoulder, Emma screamed as she saw Alice racing towards her. Jumping to her feet, she narrowly dodged her for the second time and ran towards the glass doors leading outside. Yanking the handle, she found that it was locked.

"Come on... Open!"

It cracked beneath her foot before falling away. Dropping to her knees, Emma quickly crawled through. It led to a patio connected to a set of stairs, which she instantly ran towards. 13233231121131.content:
As she made her way towards the doors of the dining room, Beth felt an odd chill descend upon the room. It had been relatively warm only a moment ago, but now, she found herself seeing her breath in the air, and rubbing her arms for warmth. Her belly gurgled noisily, and she found herself almost freezing in her tracks before she made it to the door handle.

"Is this mess yours?"

"Oh God, please nothing else, I can't deal with anyone else." Beth thought, closing her eyes at the sound of a voice she did not recognise. She turned around nervously, and found herself looking at a man around her own age; he had an aristocratic face, with extremely dark eyes and ghostly white skin. He was particularly well dressed, in clothing that looked as though it belonged in the same time frame that Aurelia hailed from; an entirely black suit with tails and an expensive looking waistcoat and tie. He was not, Beth thought, nearly as menacing as Aurelia, and even quite good looking. "Uh...hey," she said awkwardly, returning his confused glance.

"Good evening," the man said. "I ask again, did you make this mess?"

"Sort of...kinda...but I wasn't in control!" Beth blurted out.

"I see," the man said, looking unamused.

"It'll sound crazy, but-"

The man held up a hand, cutting her short. "No need to explain. I assume, by the state of this table, that Lady Belview forced this feast upon you as another one of her hedonistic experiments. Ghastly woman."

"Yes! That's right!" Beth said, relieved she didn't have to explain further, if a little worried that this guy seemed to know her tormentor. "You know her?"

"Sadly," he said, shaking his head at the leftovers of the feast. "My name is Lord Martin Harrison, and I was the owner of this mansion before I was forced to sell it to Lady Belview."

"The-the owner...before..." Beth trailed off as she realised the implication. This guy was another ghost. Though he didn't seem as hostile as the last.

"Yes, had I not needed the money to continue my research, I would never have agreed to the deal," Lord Harrison stepped closer to Beth, not really seeming to notice, or care, about her exposed belly. "But...needs must. Science required sacrifice, and I am still here, I suppose..."

"Yep," Beth said, the only thing she could really think of. She just wanted to leave. But she didn't want to anger this guy either. "Listen uh...my Lord...could you uh...help me out here? That fat bitch took control of my body, I think she's gone now but..."

Initially startled by the appearance of the Cosplay Demon, Emma's surprise gradually transformed into curiosity. Taking a few steps back so they weren't face-to-face, she reached out a hand to rest on the Damon's shoulder. The Demon stopped, looking down at her hand.

"Wow, seems really realistic..." Emma muttered, pinching and tugging on the skin. "Wings, horns and a tail as well... Question is, which one of you guys is trying to scare the daylights of me? Carrie? Nah, too slim. With a body like that, it's gotta be Beth, right?"

'Beth' merely chuckled again in response, stepping forwards and closing the distance between them again. Emma, now believing it was Beth trying to spook her, merely continued to inspect the supposed costume. Stepping around 'Beth', she began to inspect her wings.

"Huh... They feel real," She realised, stroking her fingers down them. "And they... move? How are you doing that?"

Again, 'Beth' chuckled maliciously. Just as Emma's hand began to trace the outline of her wings, she flapped them hard. Emma stumbled backwards as 'Beth' floated off the ground, her wings beating lightly as she spun to face her.

"O-Okay, maybe you aren't Beth..." Emma said anxiously, looking up at the figure.

"Yes, maybe I'm not Beth," The figure agreed. "I'm something a lot worse than Beth. Something your friend helped release and grant more power to. And I intend to use that power on the uninvited guests within my new house!"

The figure cackled loudly, causing Emma to rapidly back away. She stared in disbelief at the Demon, utterly confused about what was happening. One of her friends helped release her? Was she trapped somewhere? And what was she going to do with her uninvited guests, who she guessed included her, Carrie, Beth, Katie and Stacy, if Stacy was still around.

"But how rude of me!" The Demoness stopped laughing and stared down at Emma. "I never even introduced myself! My name is Serena, and I am the new owner of this house. Which is unfortunate for you, because I have a feeling I'm going to be a lot more unforgiving towards intruders than that decrepit obese old hag!"

Now completely creaked out by the Demoness, Emma decided it was time to run. Spinning on her heel, she sprinted down the corridor, laughter echoing down the corridor. As she rounded a corner and entered a new corridor, she glanced over her shoulder. Her eyes widened as she saw Serena leisurely floating after her.

Crap, gotta get away from her... Emma thought, eyes flicking left and right as she looked for an open door. Don't really want to find out what happens if she catches me...

A few seconds later, Emma spotted a door that was slightly ajar. Pushing it open, she rushed inside and slammed it behind her, fiddling briefly with the lock. Heading it click, followed by a sigh on the other side of the door, she breathed easy. Turning to rest her back against the door, Emma looked around the room she was trapped in...
1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.title: Serena's New Toy

1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.content:
"Yes?"

Emma looked around the room, and saw that she was in some sort of study. There were rows of ancient looking books on the walls, and a row of small, marble plinths surrounded her, each one topped with a small, ornate looking statue of some kind. The statues seemed to be of horned, winged creatures, not unlike the woman she had just encountered.

"May I help you?" The voice asked again.

Emma had been so distracted by the decorations that she had barely even noticed the man sitting opposite him in a large, throne-like chair. She turned and waved awkwardly, managing a smile at the bemused looking guy. He was wearing an immaculate, black suit which looked like it was from another century, but he didn't look much older than Emma. He was quite handsome, but his eyes were cold and dark, and made Emma nervous.

"Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt you, I just stumbled in here by accident," Emma explained, moving closer to the desk. "You're not friends with that demon lady...right?"

The man arched an eyebrow. "Which one?"

"She said her name was Serena?"

Suddenly looking very concerned, the man stood up from his chair and moved closer to Emma. "Serena? You're sure?"

"Yeah, she said she the lady of the house or something? I turned out after...you know...the general terror I experienced."

"Hmm, that can't be good," the man said. "Then again, maybe it can?"

"I'm Emma, by the way," Emma said.

"Hmm?" The man was looking distracted, but suddenly remembered his manners. "Oh, of course, forgive me. Lord Martin Harrison."

"Hey Marty, listen, can you help me find my friends?"

Martin looked like he was considering it for a second, then he shook his head. "No, I don't think so. That doesn't sound like something I would do. But maybe you can help me?"

"Doesn't sound entirely fair, actually..." Emma said.

"No, I suppose not, but in all fairness, by helping me you will be helping your friends," Martin said. "If Serena has indeed deposed Lady Aurelia, I have a golden opportunity to reclaim this house. She is forbidden from entering any of my rooms, so you should be safe here."

"Oh, well that's reassuring and not at all terrifying."

Martin nodded, oblivious. "Exactly. It's fortunate you're here actually, I need a mortal to be able to collect the Necronomicon from the library with me."

Emma's eyes widened. "Did you say Necronomicon? Like from those Evil Dead movies?"

"The what now?" Martin asked.

"You know...Bruce Campbell? They brought it back recently as a TV show," she could see that Martin had absolutely no idea what she was talking about, so decided to just stop trying to explain herself. "Okay, never mind."

"Come with me, we must hurry," Martin said, ushering her towards the door. "Don't worry, you'll be quite safe with me. Serena's magic does not work on me."

"Oh, so it won't work on me either?" Emma said.

"Sure, why not."

Emma was about to ask another question, when Martin gently shoved her back into the corridor and locked the door behind them.

1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.content:
Looking up and down the corridor, Emma hesitated. Both paths looked the exact same, with the exception of an incredibly dusty side table with a withered plant sitting atop it decorating the right.

"Hey, Marty?"

Lord Martin did not answer her, instead heading off to his left. Emma followed him, remaining close enough that she felt something resembling safety, but not so closely that was clinging to him.

"How do you tell these hallways apart?" Emma mumbled to herself as they rounded a corner, revealing a hallway that looked the exact same as the ones she had been wandering all night.

"Rather easily," Lord Martin answered, causing her to jump. She hadn't been asking him, but rather talking to herself. "I had a hand in designing and constructing the original foundations. Then that... woman... came along and added wholly unnecessary extra rooms".

"I see..." Emma replied, her brow furrowing in confusion. He designed and built the original mansion? But this place has been here for centuries! My Great Grandfather remembered this place! What's going on here...

Following Lord Martin down another hallway, Emma didn't realise that he had suddenly halted and walked straight into his back. He barely moved, while Emma instinctively bounced backwards.

"I'm sorry!" She apologised quickly. "But why have we stopped, exactly?"

"Oh, that would be because of me!"

Peering around Lord Martin, Emma whimpered as she saw a winged demon hovering in the centre of the hallway in front of them. Her tail swished lazily through the air as she hovered closer to the duo. Emma closed the distance between Lord Martin and herself, her arms wrapping around one of his.

"Serena," Lord Martin greeted coldly. "I see you've escaped your dimension".

"No thanks to you, Martin," Serena responded, just as cold. "But as you can see, I have a new dimension now. And there's a few... pests running free in it. And you know how much I enjoy toying with pests..."

"Yes, I recall perfectly," Lord Martin responded. "It was part of the reason we banished you to that fridge. I suppose congratulations are in order about it as well. You managed to get Aurelia and myself to agree on something, a near impossibility. But I'm afraid I must request that you return to that fridge".

"Oh?" Serena cocked an eyebrow curiously. "And for what reason would I do that?"

"You were a flawed creation," Lord Martin answered. "And because of you, I refused to create another like you. I will not have my past mistakes roaming these halls freely. Now, return at once! Otherwise, you will force my hand!"

Serena merely giggled and looked past him at Emma.

"Ah, I see now..." She muttered to herself. "You need a mortal for that book. Well, what happens if I take that mortal from you?"

Emma's eyes went wide as Serena clicked her fingers...

1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.content:
A fog seemed to descend on the exact area where she and Martin were standing, filling the corridor and obscuring her view of everything but the heavy mist that now occupied the air. Emma waved her hand in the air, trying to clear the sudden fog, but her vision seemed to be distorted now too. Through the mist, she could now see colours and shapes beginning to form, and when it finally cleared, she appeared to be in a completely different location. Gone were the old corridors and doorways, gone was Serena and Lord Martin and in front of her was a large, open space which appeared to be a large field.

There was some of the greenest grass she had ever seen, with a flowing river and plenty of trees, flowers and plants. It was weirdly idyllic, and not at all like anything she had seen at the mansion. She took a step forward and sniffed the oddly sweet air. "Where the hell am I?" She asked out loud.

"Oh, hey Emma!"

Emma was caught off guard by the deep, but very familiar voice, and turned and looked behind her. Her jaw dropped as she saw an enormous, spherical woman who looked to be about ten feet tall, her body almost completely globular. Her massive frame was supported by a huge, fat belly and massive, exposed, breasts. She was completely naked, and as Emma looked up at her, she recognised the big, chubby face. It was Carrie. For a moment, she found her throat so dry she could barely speak.

"C-Carrie?!" Emma blurted out. "Is that you? Wh-what happened? Why are you so big...and...and...big!"

"Oh, you mean my height," the deep voice Carrie replied, barely seeming to register Emma's confusion. "I've been growing bigger all over, to support all this extra chub. Growing up and out hehe..."

"Okay, well...not entirely what I meant..." Emma muttered. "I was asking more about the massive weight gain! Did that demon do this to you?!"

"Ooooooh," Carrie said, shifting her huge bulk from side to side as she took a wobbly step forward, her entire body jiggling. She didn't seem to really be able to move very much with all this weight weighing her down. "Well, I mostly did it to myself actually...though Serena did give me a helping hand. Isn't it great? I'm enormous!"

"Great?!" Emma could hardly believe what she was hearing. "Carrie, you're gigantic! You're on the verge of being immobile. How the hell are you enjoying this?"

Carrie just looked bemused. "This is what I wanted, Emma. I'm much happier this way!"

"Carrie, this isn't you!" Emma protested. "Nobody would want to be this huge blimp! She must have done something to your mind, how do we get out of here?"

"Oh, you can't get out without Serena's help."

Emma turned as she heard another voice, and stared in confusion once again as a chubby, overfed blonde walked up towards her. Like Carrie, she was completely naked, though normal sized and not nearly as round. Still, she looked like she was pushing over three hundred pounds. Emma tried to look away, but anywhere she looked she was seeing huge boobs and massive bellies. It was highly awkward. "Uh, hey, and you are?"

"Oh, I'm Lauren," the girl said, extending a hand. "Are you one of Carrie's friends?"

"Yeah, Emma," Emma said, offering her hand and shaking Lauren's own, while trying to maintain eye contact with her. "Can you explain to me what happened here? Carrie seems a little...um...confused.."

"Yeah, she's eaten a lot, I think she's a little food drunk," Lauren giggled. "It's fine though, we were both cool with this."

Emma raised an eyebrow. "You were both cool with being fattened up? What the hell is going on here? My friend is the size of a house!"

"Well, there's a lot of temptations here," Lauren shrugged, as though that answered Emma's protests.

Emma looked around, as though to humour Lauren, and found herself taking a closer look at their environment. In the lush, green landscape, it seemed as though there were a few details Emma had missed when she first arrived. The flower was not water...it was chocolate. The flowers were candy canes. The plants had food growing on them. The trees were made of what appeared to be some sort of candy floss. This was weird.

"What the hell...is this place...made of food?"

"Well, most of it," Lauren answered, reaching down to the floor to snap off a candy cane and take a large bite out of it. "Try some!"

Emma backed away nervously...
1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.title: Serena's dimension

1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.content:
Staring at the half-eaten candy cane, Emma had to admit that it did indeed look incredibly tasty. Even its colour, traditional red and white stripes, looked incredibly vibrant, glinting slightly in the bright sunlight.

"I guess... a bite wouldn't hurt..." Emma shrugged, reaching a hand out to accept the came. But as she wrapped her fingers around it...

"LOOK OUT!!!"

All three girls looked around in shock as a voice, familiar to two of them, let out a scream. A second later, four screams were emitted as a body smashed heavily into the ground a few feet behind Emma. Emma dropped the candy cane and hurried over to the newly formed crater, while Lauren finished off the dropped cane before following. As for Carrie, being ten feet tall, all she had to do was look towards the crater, which had a cloud of dirt obscuring it, to see who had created it.

"Are you okay?!" Emma asked anxiously, reaching the side of the crater and peering into it.

"Y-Yeah, I think so..."

As the dirt fell back to the ground, a slim girl came into view. Her blonde hair was bedraggled and flecked with dirt, while her our jeans and crop top had sustained some damage from her collision with the ground. Slowly, she got to her feet, stumbling slightly as she straightened up.

"Ow, ow, ow..." Beth groaned, clutching her lower back. "That really hurt... Oh, hey! Emma!"

Spotting her friend, Beth's pain seemed to recede as she raced up the edge of the crater to embrace the concerned girl. Emma hesitated before hugging back.

"B-Beth?" She asked, now completely confused. She had one friend the size of a house, and another had just plummeted from the sky. "Where'd you come from?"

"Well..." Beth pulled back and tapped her chin. "I was in some sort of parlour when this really slim blonde girl found me. She was in tears, saying her sister had been taken from her and she was next! Before I could ask what she meant, this other weird woman with wings and a tail appeared! She just clicked her fingers and suddenly, I was falling from the sky!"

"Oh, you met Lady Alice and Serena!" Lauren realised, finally reaching the duo. Beth glanced over at her, her face contorting in visible disgust.

"Why are you so fat?" She asked, causing Emma to sign heavily. Beth had never been one for subtlety. Rather than being annoyed, Lauren blushed.

"Aw, thanks!" Lauren giggled. "I'd say I worked really hard to get like this, but I had a lot of help from my girlfriend!"

"Carrie's your girlfriend?" Emma asked, slightly shocked. She had never known Carrie to be into girls before.

"That's right!" A deep voice came from behind them.

All three looked up at Carrie, who was happily munching on a handful of flowers. Lauren blushed a vibrant red, while Emma hadn't a clue what to think. Beth, on the other hand...

"Carrie?!" She yelped. "W-Why are you so fat?!"

"Oh, a lot of help from Lauren and Mistress Serena!" Carrie replied happily. "It's great being so big, just eating all the time... Having my girlfriend take care of me..."

Lauren giggled nervously, causing Emma and Beth to exchange a look.

"That's... great," Emma eventually replied. "But we don't want to be fat, so we'll just be leaving now..."

Grabbing Beth by the shoulder, Emma began to march off. She knew Lauren had said they needed Serena to get out, but she didn't believe that for a moment. There had to be a way out of here...

1432122111112231313122111111211111333132.content:
Beth and Emma turned and began to walk away. Lauren and Carrie made no effort to stop them, quickly returning to eating and giggling amongst themselves.

"This place is so weird," Emma said in a hushed voice. "Since when was Carrie into girls?"

"That's what strikes you as weird?!" Beth asked, incredulous.

"Well, that, and her enormous weight gain."

"It's really creeping me out," Beth said. "She wasn't herself at all. I mean, I know she'd put a few pounds on lately, but geez...she was like a blob! We need to get out of here and change her back."

"Unless you've got a super rigorous exercise program, I think that might take some work," Emma sighed.

Emma had no idea where they were going, and sadly, Beth seemed to be following her lead. They were heading down a path which crunched under their feet. Emma had initially assumed the path was made out of stone, but when she looked down she noticed it was a much darker shade of brown, and seemed to be cracking under her shoes. She stopped for a moment and crouched down to get a closer look, picking up a piece of the broken path and raising it in front of her glasses. It was chocolate. The path was chocolate. This was insane.

Tossing the chocolate back on the floor, she waved away Beth's incoming question and decided to just keep going. The open fields were still around them, but they now seemed to be coming to what sounded like more flowing water. As they neared the source of the noise, they descended a small hill and found themselves at the bank of an enormous chocolate river. There was no bridge, and did not appear to be any way across other than to swim, but in the distance, Emma could see what seemed to be...the house? Were they outside after all? That certainly made more sense than them being in some sort of bizarre alternate reality. She would have recognised that creepy mansion anywhere, although it now seemed to be the day time, rather than night. Had they really been here that long?

"I guess we're outside, huh..." Beth said, looking across the river.

"Yeah, but how do we get across? This river seems to stretch on for miles," Emma said.

The girls peered down into the flowing, chocolatey river below them. It was swimmable, but would leave them completely covered and their clothes ruined. Surely there was an easier way to get back to the house?

"What?! That stuff looks like quicksand!"

"Oh come on, it's not that bad," Emma said. She leaned forward and dipped her fingers into the river, pulling them back out and licking them clean. "Yep, definitely chocolate."

"Erm...should you be eating that stuff?" Beth asked.

"Well, one of us had to test it," Emma shrugged. "Besides, not like I'm downing the entire lake. So, we crossing this or what?"

"Do we have another choice?" Beth asked, folding her arms.

"Not that I can see," Emma said. "Worst case scenario? Our clothes are ruined."

"I mean, that's pretty bad, actually," Beth replied.

Emma realised she probably wasn't going to convince Beth any time soon unless she took some action. She sat down on the river bank and dipped her leg into the river, grimacing as it sank beneath the chocolate. Slowly but surely, she lowered her other leg, up to the knee, into the river, and pushed her body off the bank. With a "plop", Emma's body sank, up to her waist, into the river. She breathed a sigh of relief as she realised it wasn't that high after all.

"Is it...okay?" Beth asked, approaching her from behind.

"Doesn't seem too bad, actually," Emma said. "Come on, let's get moving."

Emma tried to get moving, but the amount of chocolate surrounding her body made that difficult. It was very hard to wade through the thick, gooey river, but it was doable, so she slowly started making her way to the other side of the river.

Behind her, Beth was making a nervous noise as she dipped her leg into the chocolate. She was about to slowly lower herself in when she lost her balance and slipped in with a scream. Thankfully, the thickness of the chocolate prevented her from falling face first into the river, and she managed to stop herself, though her arms were now completely covered. "Eurghhhhh! Gross!"

"Come on, we can wash off once we get back," Emma called back.

Without thinking, Beth wiped her hands on her top, smearing it with even more chocolate. "Oh crap...why did I do that? Ugh. I hate this place."

The two girls, moving slowly but surely, started to make their way across the river...

Things were going well for the two girls. The river, despite being made of chocolate, was neither deep nor relatively fast-flowing, meaning they were making good progress crossing it. However, about halfway across...

Emma glanced over her shoulder, but made sure to keep moving forwards. After all, she didn't fancy getting bogged down or caught by something living in the river, if such a beast existed.

"Carrie, there you are, you found anything yet?" Emma asked, walking up to the table. "Oh, hey, cake?"

Carrie did a double take as Emma gestured to a large, chocolate cake on the table. How the hell had that gotten there? She had eaten the entire thing just a second ago and there definitely hadn't been another one in sight. Shocked, she pushed herself back from the table, relaxing her belly a little so that it puffed out against her shirt, straining the buttons.

Emma was not oblivious to Carrie's bloated state, even with the poor girl trying hard to hold her breath. "Erm, Carrie, you didn't like...eat any of that cake did you? I mean, who knows how long it might have been there."

"Of course not," Carrie blushed, realising how ridiculous that probably sounded when there were obvious cake crumbs in her lap. "But I'm sure it's perfectly...erm...fresh..."

Carrie rose from her chair, putting added pressure on her buttons as her stomach bulged out in front of her. Emma had the decency to ignore it, but her eyes wandered back to the cake. "Who leaves a cake just lying here? You think maybe Stacey left it for us? As a "thank you for coming to rescue me" present?"

Carrie raised an eyebrow.

"You're right, probably not her style. Or anybody's."

Carrie shifted awkwardly, tugging at her shirt to try and hide the very visible bulge beneath it. "This is going to sound crazy but...that cake literally just appeared out of nowhere."

This time, Emma raised an eyebrow. "Erm..."

"Yeah I know how it sounds, don't give me that look!" Carrie protested. "I swear, it just appeared the second you walked in! This place is weird!"

Emma leaned in for a closer look, staring down at the thick, chocolatey cake on the table. "Looks good though..."
1432123.title: More cake suddenly appears...

choices: Emma finishes the cake, but more appears...
Emma finishes the cake, the girls decide to move on from the kitchens...
Someone else walks in...
14321231.content:
Without hesitation, Emma suddenly reached for a pre-cut slice of the enormous, gooey cake and lifted it to her mouth. Before she could take a bite, Carrie intervened, pulling her hand away. "Emma, seriously, there's something weird going on with that cake."

"You just want it all to yourself," Emma laughed, before pushing Carrie off and chomping down on the slice she was holding.

"Fine, be like that," Carrie grumbled, folding her arms across her chest, shifting uncomfortably as they pressed down on her stuffed belly.

"Oh my God this cake is incredible!" Emma moaned, her eyes bulging with delight as she reached for another piece, her current, half eaten slice still in her other hand. "More please," she giggled as she took a bite from the new slice.

"You haven't even finished the other slice yet," Carrie protested, pointing to the leftovers in Emma's other hand.

Emma nodded in agreement, and crammed the remains of her first helping into her mouth, before swallowing them and moving onto the other slice. "Happy?" She asked, her cheeks bulging.

"Not really, but okay."

Emma reached for her third slice of cake, before pulling out a chair from the table and sitting down. She pulled the silver platter containing the cake towards her until it was directly beneath her nose, and then started helping herself to more and more. Carrie watched from just behind Emma's chair, watching helplessly as her friend mindlessly ate her way through slice after slice. Was this what she had looked like a few minutes ago? Just a ravenous, greedy pig devouring cake slices whole?

"Emma, slow down, you're going to choke," Carrie warned, taking a step closer.

"Can't, cake too good..." Emma responded, wiping chocolate from around her mouth as she went for another slice. The cake was around halfway gone now, but Emma showed no signs of slowing down. In fact, her appetite only seemed to increase.

Beneath the table, Carrie caught sight of Emma's stomach slowly swelling out. Emma had always had a curvy figure, but her stomach had stayed pretty slim over the years, never really accumulating any of the extra chub that Carrie's had after her college years. Instead, any excess weight Emma put on seemed to go straight to her butt, which now seemed to be straining a little against her tight jeans as her belly exerted extra pressure on them.

"URRRRP!" Emma belched suddenly, but didn't seem bothered by her gassy outburst, instead just following it up with extra cake.

Beside her, Carrie glanced down at her own burgeoning belly, still packed full of the same cake. Her buttons looked ready to pop open, and her skirt dug into her soft belly. She ran a hand over the expanse of her bloated tummy, before looking back at Emma, seeing her in a similar state. Emma's t-shirt was much more form fitting than Carrie's work shirt, and was beginning to constrict around her expanding stomach, riding up above belly button and exposing her midriff...
14321231.title: Emma starts eating the cake...

choices: Carrie and Emma continue their search of the ground floor...
Carrie and Emma are very slowly starting to gain more weight...
They start getting hungry again...
143212311.content:
Finally, the plate was empty, and Emma lent back in her chair with a groan. Her hands fell to her overfilled stomach, which had bloated out into a round, spherical belly not all that different to Carrie's own. She ran her hands over her burgeoning stomach with a mournful sigh, before remembering Carrie was watching her, blushing and trying to suck it in as best she could.

"Had enough?" Carrie asked.

"I uh...yes? Did I really eat all that cake? God..." Emma suppressed another belch, covering her hand with her mouth and trying to hide her gluttonous display. "Yeah well...I'm pretty sure you overdid it on the cake front too."

Carrie folded her arms further down her stomach, trying to hide her own greed. "I may have...but at least I didn't have someone right beside me telling me what a pig I was being!"

"I am not an URRRRRRRP...pig..." Emma moaned. "Okay, I was a bit of a pig just then."

"Mmm hmm," Carrie said. "Anyway, we should..."

Carrie trailed off as she looked back at the table, her eyes widening in surprise. There, right where the empty plate had been a second ago, was another enormous cake, exactly the same shape and size as the first two. Emma followed Carrie's confused expression back to the table and her jaw dropped.

"What the hell?!" Emma asked, incredulous.

"I told you!" Carrie said. "I told you it came out of nowhere!"

"I don't want to stay here anymore," Emma said.

"Yeah, let's get out of here," Carrie said.

Quickly, Emma rose from the table, her bloated stomach sticking out beneath her tight top as she rose. She pulled it down a little, trying to hide her round, protruding stomach, but that was a difficult task with it's current size. Her smaller clothing wasn't quite as suited to covering up her feast as Carrie's work clothes. Together, the girls turned and hurried away from the table, exiting the dining room through the huge double doors and returning to the entrance of the house...
143212311.title: Endless cake

145.content:
Shrugging, Carrie started down the hallway of doors. She peeked into a few of them, calling out Stacey's name, but the only answer she ever received was the squeak of a disturbed mouse. Reaching the end of the corridor, she was presented with another choice. The corridor to her left led to her another door filled hallway, while the right had one glass door that led outside.

"I'm sure the other girls have the inside handled," Carrie muttered to herself. "And Stacey always liked the outdoors more. If she'd be anywhere, she be somewhere outside".

Carrie moved towards the glass door, pushing it open. It led to a large balcony with some decorative furniture that overlooked a number of different areas. Straight ahead of the balcony were a number of large greenhouses. A few lights populated them, which intrigued Carrie. If this place was meant to be abandoned, why were there lights everywhere?

Off to the right of the greenhouses, and far off in the distance, was what looked like a barn. Every so often, the silence of the night was broken by a distant animal noise. Carrie heard all sorts of animals calling out, from cows and pigs to sheep and chickens.

And finally, the left housed a massive forest. At her first glance, it appeared to be completely overgrown, however a closer look showed a single path leading into it.

"She could be anywhere!" Carrie moaned. "Why'd you have to get lost, Stacey?"
After a moment's thought, Carrie decided to inspect the...
145.title: The Mansion Grounds

1451.content:
"If those greenhouses are getting power, then someone has to be living here...or at best...someone turned them on recently." she said as she hurried over to the row of greenhouses.

She checked each one carefully. As she investigated the greenhouses, she noticed something that caught her attention. Each of the greenhouses was meant to house a different sort of vegetation. In one, she saw nothing but flowers while in another, there was nothing but fruit bearing plants and even in a third was nothing but vegetables.

"Hmm...its a little odd they only keep certain plants in separate greenhouses...what's even stranger...all of these plants seem alive and healthy and this place has been rumored to have been unattended to in years. So how can all of these plants still be so healthy? Maybe Stacey went and watered them or something. No...not possible. She's only been gone a day. That isn't nearly enough..." she said before hearing something break inside one of the greenhouses. She followed the source of the sound to...
1451.title: The Greenhouses

14513.content:
Carrie stood in front of the fruit greenhouse. Through the glass of the greenhouse, she could see all kinds of delectible fruit. Cautiously, Carrie opened the door, and entered.

The inside looked just like an everyday greenhouse, with rows of tables containting various fruits. She also realized that, for a greenhouse, it was oddly cold.

"I guess that makes sense." Carrie thought, shivering a little. "Fruit does need to stay refrigerated. But what on Earth in here could have made that breaking sound?"

Carrie started to wander around the greenhouse, taking mental note of all the various fruits. Some of them she recognized right away, and some of them took a little bit. There were some, however, that looked almost otherworldly. What on Earth was being grown here? And who was growing them.

Eventually, Carrie finally found something that looked like it could be the source of the breaking sound. One of the back windows to the greenhouse had shattered. As she got closer, she noticed there were no glass shards in the greenhouse. Going to the hole, she stuck her head out. Looking on the ground outside, she finally saw the glass shards.

"So something broke out of here?" Carrie asked herself. "But what? And why? So many questions."

As she pondered, she was suddenly hit with a wonderful aroma. It smelled quite a bit like...
14513.title: Fruit Greenhouse

145131.content:
Carrie knew she was doing the former owner a favour, as she plucked a handful of berries from the bushes. They'd only go to waste otherwise. She popped them one after another like sweets. They were delicious, and meant to be good for you. Carrie knew she'd... lost a little tone with her new job. It wasn't her fault it was mostly desk bound.

The greenhouse disappeared around the corner, and the aroma of fruit drew her forward. There were more blueberry bushes bedded around the path, and grapes on vines trailing up the outer wall of the house. The greenhouse windows were grubby, but gave a dulled view of the garden beyond.

She spotted a path running parallel to the greenhouse and the mansion. A selection of fruit trees planted every few feet. Alternating between apple trees, and various fruit bushes. The air was filled with the scent of herbs to add to the inviting aroma.

Looking up from the path, she spotted what looked like a dense forest. But it was too close, and too regular to be that. Walking carefully off the path, she approached the outer glass, and rubbing it clear with the sleeve of her jumper, saw it more clearly.

It was a maze... an actual hedge maze! The grass was wild, but it didn't look too overgrown.

Finding the far door to the greenhouse, Carrie left it, and found herself outside the kitchen door. A gravel path leading into the maze.

1452.content:
She cautiously headed over to the barn where she heard the animal noises but to her surprise, there wasn't a single animal present at said barn. "That's...so weird. I was sure I heard something over here." she said looking the place over.

She checked the nearby pigpen for any sign of pigs but none were seen. She went over to the nearby chicken coop but saw no sign of any chickens there, not even a single feather or egg inside it. She even went over into the barn. She checked it over but saw no cows, sheep, horses or any other animals that would have been living inside of it.

"Okay, this is just too weird. I heard animal sounds coming from over here but once I get over here, I can't find a single..." she said before a sound rang in her eyes. The sound was a bell, the kind most cattle would wear around their necks. She held her head as the bell's sounds grew louder and louder before she suddenly passed out there on the barn floor.

She awoke a while later, rubbing her head. However, she felt that her body was a bit different. It wasn't until after she left the barn she realized what was wrong.

She wanted to turn back a few times but realized once she was a good portion of the way in there was no light to follow the trail back. So she started running down the trail as she looked around for the best way out of the woods.

After what seemed like forever ago, she stopped to take a breather right there in the middle of the path. "Well...that's it. I'm gonna end up having to live out here in the woods like a..." she said before seeing a light at the end of the path. "Light! Finally!" she said following after the light as best she could. Once she had followed it for awhile, she soon found herself outside of the woods and standing before...

151.content:
Upon a black hill, nearing the midnight hours, seven women stood outside the broken manor of Lady Aurelia Belview. A witch carried an Oujia Board up the creaking steps while followed by a parade of fiends and villains. A more accurate description would actually be a costumed witch was followed by a line of her friends.

"And we're here!" The witch named Sara proclaimed. "I told you we'd be here before midnight!"

"Are you gals sure this is a good idea?" Annabelle spoke as she saw her six other friends move towards the doors. The cowgirl quivered a little from the cold. "I'm not part-tickulary inclined towards messing with the second world."

"Please,you really believe in those old tales about this place?" Ashley stated. She twiddled her pirate outfit to pull down near her knees. "I mean its--like--stuff to scare babies or something."

"I ain't 'fraid of no ghost!" Melissa screamed out. She gladly rushed past Sara and pushed open the dusty door, all the while her ghost costume flapped in the wind. "What are you gals waiting for? Come on!"

"Want some food Kim?" Beverley said. Her pumpkin outfit tight against her fairly plump form. "I got blueberries, your favorite!"

"Oh thank you Kim!" Kim happily stated as she was handed a fruit snack from her friend. She chewed absentmindedly, doing her best not to color her pilgrim outfit. Rounding out this motley crew was Dallas, who babbled on her phone to a unknown caller.

"Don't worry Honey-Bun! Me and the girls--or is it the girls and I, whatever--are going to be back before one o' clock! Don't worry we'll be there to watch the spooky flicks. Love you!"

All seven women crowded into the main lobby and looked around. Dust, broken wood, and old furniture greeted them.

"Ew" Ashley stated. "Do we have go anywhere else? "

"Nope. We can just do it right here." Sara happily replied. "Everyone ready to set the place up?"

The rest of the girls nodded and began to place down their accompanying materials. Candles, flashlights, and chalk were all placed down onto the floor. Two of the girls began to draw the appropriate circle and place the candles onto the floor. Sara in turn began to take out a tome and began flipping through the pages.Finding the pages she wanted, Sara placed down the Oujia board and book onto the ground. Sitting down, she began to recite while the other girls took their places.Dallas helpfully placed a clock down to indicate the time.

"Oh Aurelia Belview. Oh Aurelia Belview. Come back towards our realm and manifest your will onto this material plane. Oh Aurelia Belview. Oh Aurelia Belview. Come back to the home you took your final breath in."

"This is so cool!" Beverly stated. Snacking on another snack with Kim. The six girls watched as Sara began to repeat her chants. Her tone growing louder and louder and her arms raising higher above her head. Finally she chanted out the last verse from the tome.

"Oh Aurelia Belview. Come back to the Earthly Kingdom. I, Sara Hensley, call you home!"

Sara chanted the last word out and all six ladies braced themselves for an apparition to form in the circle. Nothing appeared. They tapped their feet or twiddled their thumbs in waiting. The clock ranged, indicating it was midnight. The girls waited again,but like before, nothing appeared.

"I thought there was going to be a pale lady or a spooky mistress,Sara? Where is it, come on!" Dallas whined.

"Guess she was too scared to come!" Melissa screamed out. "We'll I'll get rid of this stupid circle."

"Wait! Meliss-" It was too late, Melissa already rubbed her foot down onto the white chalk on the floor and got rid of the stains. The other girls didn't seem to care much for the action and shrugged when nothing came out.

"Looks like this was a waste of time." Ashley proclaimed.

"Who needs to see some fat lady anyways?" Kim spoke. Stuffing another blueberry into her mouth. Beverly nodded before she turned to glare at Kim.

"Hey!"

"I'm not talking about you. You're plump, not fat."

"Ah. thanks!"

Annabelle chewed her lower lip in apprehension,tapping her foot mindlessly. Sara got up and began to flip through the book. Not seeing anything to mediate the situation she sighed.

"Sorry girls, it looks like I was wrong. Stupid book." Sara tucked her tome into her bag and began to clean up the lobby.

Invisible and above them flew the spirit of the manor, Aurelia. She glared down at the assembled girls.

"Fat! Too sacred! A waste of time?" Aurelia screamed. "It wasn't my fault that mouthy girl of your's didn't know how to properly calibrate a freaking clock! And that idiot destroyed the circle before they could even dispel me! Don't you dare insult me about my worth if you can't even possess some caution.

Aurelia tapped her ghostly finger against her chin as she saw the girls begin to clean up.

"You want me to show you my worth? My talents? My skills? Well I'll show you just how 'talented' I can get."

Breathing out wisps of blue smoke, the weird air traveled down and began to caress the ladies' forms. A sudden chill went over all of them,but they brushed it off as the cold night. Opening the door, Melissa held it as the ladies moved outside.
151.title: The Summoning in The Haunted House

15132.content:
The pirate dressed girl ruffled her skirt, cold from the chilly air. She had thought the leggings she wore would've warmed her up, but it only mitigated the effects by a small margin. In fact, it seemed to be clinging to her body a little tighter than expected.

"Its probably late-night shrinkage." Ashley mumbled. Behind her, Annabelle the country girl cried out.

"Urgh, it's so cold..." Annabelle whined, rubbing her bare arms in a futile attempt to heat them. "The mansion may have been spooky, but at least it was warm".

"Well, if it was so warm, why not go back in?" Ashley suggested with a grin on her face. "I'll even go with you, just so you don't get lonely. Or scared!"

Ashley giggled internally at the suggestion, Annabelle wasn't one know for her courage. So the light-hearted ribbing would probably take her mind off the tightness of her skirt.. It seemed that Ashley didn't quite keep those giggles inside of herself as Annabelle pouted at the girl.

"I'm... I'm not scared!" She protested. "I just think messing with the dead is... unfair to the dead! Yeah, that's it! I mean, how would you like it if a bunch of girls tried talking to you after you died and just wanted to rest?"

"Rest? I wouldn't spend my time resting!" Ashley replied. "I'd be one of those annoying ghosts that moves stuff around the house and makes spooky noises in the middle of the night!"

Ashley's mind wandered to the thought of her floating around and moaning at those bitches from Atticus Academy. White sheet not touching the ground, blank face hidden under it.

"Course you would..." Annabelle mumbled under her breath.

"Alright, you two, give it a rest," Sarah said, interrupting the duo. "In fact, while we're here, why not have a few dares? After all, we just proved that Lady Aurelia isn't currently home".

"What'd you have in mind?" Kim asked, wiping some blue juice from her mouth.

"Go in and find a certain room?" Sarah suggested. "And don't worry, Annabelle, we won't force you if you don't want to go".

"W-What? I do wanna go!" Annabelle said bravely, straightening up slightly. "In fact, I'll go first! Pick a room!"

"Okay... Find the Master Bedroom!" Sarah said. "And take a picture so we know you've been there!"

"Master bedroom? E-Easy!"

Ashley's eyebrow rose at Annabelle's new-found courage and was really tempted to follow her just to see her go through with it. Shrugging, she and the others opened up the doors to the house to allow Annabelle entrance. Closing it gently, the girls sat down and began to converse.

"So what would you even ask the ghost if we summoned her?" Dallas questioned. "I mean she's not exactly up to date with world news."

"I would've asked about her wealth of course." Sara chirped. The girl's eyebrows rose at her response. Ashley was the only one not to do so, for she was the reason Sara knew about that in the first place.

"I was just going ask for some recipes, but your's is way cooler!" Beverly replied, she tugged on her shirt a little, and was that pudge Ashley saw? Shaking her head, she listened on.

"Yep. You see Aurelia may have been very wealthy, but it seemed that she didn't leave behind any will. And while the banks fatten themselves on whatever they could get, they never really got the true juiciness of the Belviews." Sara replied. The other girls eyes grew wide in wild thought.

Fifteen minutes later, Annabelle voice came from behind the doors.

"Girls! I wanna get outta here! Please!" Annabelle said in her most steady voice, but she couldn't quite keep the terror down. Slowly the door began to open, greeting Annabelle with faces of her friends.

"You okay Annabelle?" Beverly stated, looking at her friend. Ashley had a playful grin on her face as she saw the woman, while the others faces were covered with various degrees of worry.

Annabelle weirdly moved herself in front of the others, but Ashley just jotted that down to the country girl trying to warm herself up.

"Yeah, riggghhhttt..." Ashley teased. But she did wonder if Annabelle actually got any pictures from the place.Dallas however pushed past everybody to proclaim her annoyance.

"Everyone ready, good, awesome? Okay, because Honey-Bun has made snacks and they're getting cold right now, so lets get to my house, chop-chop!" Dallas announced. She walked down the steps of the manor and motioned for the girls to follow her. Sara shrugged, going over to Dallas. The rest of the girls fell into place with Annabelle being the last one to move.

"Damn skirt, It seems even tighter now!" Ashley whispered under her hushed breath.
15132.title: Ashley's Skirt felt tighter as well as her ...

151321.content:
"Honey-Bun!" Dallas cried out as she hugged her boyfriend, Mike. The group had finally arrived Dallas' house, and in luckily for them too, for it seemed that the night dropped about seventeen degrees lower than before. Rushing inside, the group let out a collective sigh of relief to be out of the cold and into the warm. Ashley shifted her booty a little bit, her tights still weirdly clingy to her lower half.

"I might as well see what wrong in the bathroom." Ashley thought, but before she could go forth, somebody else beat her too it, five somebodies.

"Hey Dallas, my gal, can I use the Lou?" Melissa announced. Ashley looked over to her the ghost girl and swore she could hear something like a balloon blowing up under the sheets.

"Dallas, can Kim and me both use the bathrooms? Beverly pleaded, while Kim nodded in approval. Kim's skin seemed to be colored in a strange blue hue, while Beverly seemed a little flabbier near the arms. Which given the amount she usually eats, didn't surprise Ashley that much, it seemed like the weight had finally caught up to her.

"Dallas, my friend, I may need to use you latrine." Sara spoke. Ashley stared at the Gothic witch and her eyebrows rose a little. Ashley could faintly see that Sara had gained a minor hourglass figure or maybe Ashley was just hallucinating.

"Um. Dallas I think I need to use the potty." Annabelle humbly said. Ashley looked over to her and could see the cowgirl adjust her top in discomfort. Ashley swore she saw Annabelle's breasts constrict against the bindings.

Dallas looked over to her friends--and Ashley saw her lips had grown a little plumper--scratching her head in thought. She spoke a little while later, after coming to her own conclusion.

"Girls. We have two bathrooms, you don't have to ru-" Before she could finish, the group raced past the girl.

It being a one-story house, didn't allow much room for movement, but it's linear path did allow a straight shot to the latrines. And it seemed like somebody had already won.

"Yes!" Melissa screamed out,somehow not tripping in her large cloth costume. Melissa closed the door, while the others looked at each other.

"Mine!" Ashley rushed forward,leaving the others dazed for a bit, taking a few ticks to get their nerves working again.

"Urgh, it's so cold..." Annabelle whined, rubbing her bare arms in a futile attempt to heat them. "The mansion may have been spooky, but at least it was warm".

"What'd you have in mind?" Kim asked, wiping some blue juice from her mouth.

"Go in and find a certain room?" Sarah suggested. "And don't worry, Annabelle, we won't force you if you don't want to go".

"W-What? I do wanna go!" Annabelle said bravely, straightening up slightly. "In fact, I'll go first! Pick a room!"

"Okay... Find the Master Bedroom!" Sarah said. "And take a picture so we know you've been there!"

=====


"Why'd I say this would be easy?" Annabelle whispered to herself, creeping along the dark hallway. "T-This place is super spooky..."

After marching into the foyer of the mansion, and the rest of the girls had pulled the old doors shut behind her, shrouding her in almost complete darkness, her bravado had disappeared instantly. But as much as she wanted to bang on the door and beg to be let out, she knew the other girls would never let her forget it, especially Ashley.

So, reluctantly and with an odd feeling within her chest, Annabelle began her hunt for the Master Bedroom. The first place she tried was up the once Grand Staircase, whose wooden stairs creaked beneath her feet. Until she had reached the top, she held her breath, just in case she needed to scream for help should she fall through. Thankfully, she didn't, meaning she let out a relieved sigh when she reached the top, which presented her with a choice. Left, which led into darkness, or right, which also led into darkness. After a moment of deliberation, she chose the right path, bringing her to now.

At least it's warm in here, Annabelle reasoned, adjusting her top slightly. Since she had entered the building, an odd feeling had filled her chest. Annabelle assumed it was apprehension, as she was incredibly nervous about being here. But as she crept along the hallway, the feeling persisted, as did an odd tightness in her chest...
1513321.title: Annabelle's Fearful Dare

Annabelle continued to quietly make her way down the dark hallway until, eventually, she reached the end, where a lone table with an antique base greeted her. Looking at the vase for a moment, Annabelle let out a sigh as she turned back to stare at the hallway.

"I guess it was too much to hope for plaques on the doors..." She mumbled despondently. "Suppose I should just start checking rooms..."

Moving to the door nearest her, Annabelle took a calming breath before pushing the door open. Its hinges squeaked as it swung open, revealing a bedroom of sorts that was illuminated by moonlight streaming through a dusty window. Stepping in, Annabelle froze as the floorboards creaked beneath her feet. Taking another deep breath, she stepped forwards again.

Well, it's a bedroom, Annabelle thought, glancing quickly around the musty room. But it doesn't appear... grand enough to be the Master Bedroom. Aw, well... Onto the next room, I suppose.

As Annabelle turned to leave, she caught sight of something that looked as though it didn't belong in the forgotten room. A gleaming mirror with a gilded golden frame, its surface shining and clear. Taking a cautious step towards the mirror, Annabelle found her nervous reflection staring back at her.

Why does this look so new? She wondered, running a hand over the smooth frame. Does somebody still live here? N-No, they couldn't... This place has been abandoned for almost two centuries!

Stepping back, Annabelle stared at her reflection again. She wasn't a part ugly girl, nor was she anything great to look at, but this mirror somehow made her look attractive. Her brown hair, tied back in a ponytail, swayed back and forth as she looked at herself. Her brown eyes flitted around anxiously, inspecting her average body, which was clad in an outfit that made her resemble Jesse from Toy Story, minus the hat. And yet, something seemed amiss with her reflection. Running her eye up and down her body, Annabelle quickly figured out what it was.
